column40: Transcatheter heart valves need to prove they can deploy accurately, function properly, and seal completely under real-world conditions. We test valve performance against ISO 5840 standards, run durability cycles exceeding 400 million beats, and validate anatomical fit across TAVR, TMVR, and tricuspid platforms. Our imaging capabilitiesâ€”including TEE and high-resolution fluoroscopyâ€”let us track valve positioning, leaflet movement, and any regurgitation throughout the entire study.

column45: LAA closure devices, PFO occluders, and septal defect devices face unique challenges that standard cardiac testing can't address. We evaluate how well these devices deploy in complex anatomy, stay stable during cardiac motion, and integrate with surrounding tissue over time. Our Watchman LAA testing program is one of our most established services, refined through dozens of studies that have supported both FDA submissions and post-market surveillance.

column50: Drug-eluting stents require careful validation of how the drug releases, how the polymer behaves, and how the vessel heals. We use standardized histology to measure strut coverage, inflammation, and restenosis rates over time. Our analytical methods track drug distribution in vessel walls and polymer degradation kinetics. Whether you're working with established DES platforms or newer bioresorbable scaffolds, our protocols are designed to support both 510(k) and PMA pathways.

column27: Why Choose Synchrony for Neurovascular Testing
column28: Our neurovascular testing capabilities stem from specialized focus in cerebrovascular device development, providing dedicated infrastructure, stroke intervention expertise, and proven regulatory success.
column31: Fifteen years focused exclusively on cerebrovascular device testing provides deep understanding of stroke intervention and aneurysm treatment requirements. Our protocols address unique challenges of brain tissue safety and tortuous vessel navigation while maintaining complete GLP compliance throughout neurovascular studies.
column34: Purpose-built catheterization laboratories with high-resolution angiography and real-time hemodynamic monitoring. Anatomically accurate cerebral vessel models enable clinically relevant performance assessment while specialized clot simulation systems replicate diverse thrombus compositions.
column37: Proven track record supporting successful FDA submissions for neurovascular devices across multiple regulatory pathways. Our team understands PMA requirements and 510(k) substantial equivalence demonstrations specific to stroke devices and cerebrovascular applications.
column40: Mechanical thrombectomy devices need to prove they can engage clots effectively, achieve first-pass recanalization, and preserve vessel integrity during emergency stroke procedures. We test device performance using advanced clot simulation systems that replicate diverse thrombus compositions, validating retrieval mechanics and TICI scoring across stent retrievers and combination devices. Our catheterization laboratories provide angiographic documentation of recanalization success while anatomically accurate cerebral vessel models enable realistic performance assessment throughout the entire study.
column45: Aspiration catheters require validation of vacuum force generation, clot extraction efficiency, and complete vessel recanalization across neurovascular, coronary, and peripheral applications. We evaluate aspiration performance using standardized clot compositionsâ€”from fresh platelet-rich thrombi to organized fibrin materialâ€”ensuring devices handle the full spectrum of clinical scenarios. Our testing protocols assess catheter trackability through tortuous cerebral anatomy, aspiration force consistency during extended procedures, and biocompatibility requirements for blood-contacting devices.
column46: Learn More About Aspiration Thrombectomy Testing
column50: Liquid embolic agents face unique challenges that standard biocompatibility testing can't address. We validate polymer viscosity, radiopacity, and polymerization kinetics using specialized protocols for DMSO compatibility, tantalum suspension stability, and controlled precipitation behavior. Our catheterization laboratories feature imaging systems configured specifically for liquid embolic visualization, while ISO 10993-compliant testing addresses material characterization and delivery performance across aneurysm, AVM, and peripheral embolization applications.

column27: Why Choose Synchrony Labs for Peripheral Vascular Testing
column28: Our peripheral vascular testing expertise combines 40+ years of cardiovascular device validation experience with specialized infrastructure addressing the unique requirements of carotid, aortic, venous, and embolic protection technologies.
column31: Our team recognizes that carotid stents, AAA devices, IVC filters, and embolic protection systems each require distinct testing approaches. Our protocols address territory-specific biomechanical challenges, regulatory expectations, and clinical performance requirements rather than applying generic vascular device assessment methodologies.
column34: Purpose-built testing systems address peripheral vascular requirements including high-pressure aortic simulation, cerebrovascular flow modeling, venous circulation replication, and embolic challenge systems. This specialized infrastructure enables comprehensive device validation that generic cardiovascular facilities cannot provide.
column37: Our personnel include interventional specialists with expertise across cerebrovascular, aortic, and venous territories, biomedical engineers specializing in vascular device mechanics, and regulatory experts with successful peripheral device submission experience. This combination ensures comprehensive evaluation addressing both technical performance and regulatory acceptance.
column40: Carotid stent development requires specialized cerebrovascular testing that addresses embolic risk, plaque stabilization, and vessel scaffolding in the critical carotid circulation. We evaluate embolic generation, plaque compression, and patency maintenance using anatomically accurate carotid bifurcation models that replicate the unique hemodynamics of cerebral circulation. Our testing protocols span self-expanding nitinol systems, balloon-expandable designs, and drug-eluting platforms, with advanced embolic monitoring systems evaluating particle generation during deployment across various plaque types. Specialized protocols assess plaque stabilization effectiveness, deployment precision through tortuous anatomy, and chronic thrombogenicity in the cerebrovascular environment.
column41: Learn More About Carotid Stent Testing
column45: Abdominal aortic aneurysm repair systems need to prove they can withstand systolic pressure cycles while providing complete aneurysm exclusion and maintaining critical branch vessel perfusion. We evaluate pressure containment, endoleak prevention, and structural integrity using high-pressure flow circuits and anatomically accurate aneurysm models that accommodate modular stent grafts, unibody designs, and fenestrated devices with branch vessel preservation. Advanced pressure monitoring provides real-time seal integrity assessment while leak detection systems identify potential endoleak pathways. Accelerated fatigue testing simulates decades of cardiac pressure cycles, characterizing material durability and component interface integrity throughout intended device life.
column46: Learn More About AAA Device Testing
column50: Inferior vena cava filter development requires specialized venous testing that addresses clot capture efficiency, flow preservation, and retrieval mechanics in the low-pressure, large-diameter venous environment. We evaluate embolic challenge response, anchoring stability, and biocompatibility using high-volume venous flow circuits that replicate physiological IVC hemodynamics. Our testing addresses both permanent filter designs requiring long-term biocompatibility validation and retrievable systems demanding comprehensive retrieval mechanics assessment. Advanced embolic simulation systems deliver calibrated thrombus analogs across clinically relevant size ranges while specialized protocols characterize retrieval force requirements and safe recovery timelines.
column51: Learn More About IVC Filter Testing

column27: Why Choose Synchrony for Surgical Robotics Testing
column28: Our surgical robotics testing capabilities stem from four decades of minimally invasive device development, providing specialized infrastructure, precision instrument expertise, and proven regulatory success.
column31: Dedicated surgical suite accommodates full robotic systems with patient cart positioning, vision cart integration, and surgeon console setup matching clinical configurations. Environmental controls maintain sterile conditions and consistent testing parameters throughout validation studies.
column34: Our founding heritage established by Duke University interventional cardiologists who pioneered current minimally invasive techniques provides deep understanding of precision surgical requirements. This cardiovascular specialization translates directly to robotic surgery validation, addressing teleoperation accuracy, force feedback systems, and safety protocols essential for FDA submission success.
column37: AAALAC accreditation ensures highest standards for surgical research protocols while GLP compliance under 21 CFR Part 58 provides regulatory documentation required for FDA submissions. Our quality management system delivers complete traceability and comprehensive documentation supporting successful regulatory pathways for complex electromechanical systems.
column40: Flexible endoscopic systems for robotic surgery require validation of mechanical articulation, visualization performance, and working channel functionality. We test articulation range across multiple degrees of freedom, tip deflection precision under varying loads, and camera resolution for diagnostic imaging. Our protocols evaluate illumination stability, image transmission quality, and working channel patency throughout articulation cycles. Our optical testing equipment and mechanical fatigue systems track performance metrics throughout thousands of articulation cycles to ensure devices meet ISO 8600 standards.
column45: Minimally invasive surgical instruments for robotic platforms require precise characterization of grasping forces, articulation accuracy, and tissue manipulation capabilities. We evaluate instrument jaw closure forces, articulation precision through multi-degree motion, and durability under repeated actuations exceeding 10,000 cycles per procedure. Our testing protocols assess trocar seal integrity, instrument clearance through access ports, and mechanical stability during tissue manipulation. Our surgical suites feature complete laparoscopic towers and insufflation systems that replicate operating room conditions throughout validation studies.
column50: Complete robotic surgical systems require validation of teleoperation accuracy, force feedback calibration, and tremor filtration effectiveness. We test motion scaling verification, emergency stop response times, and software integration between console and patient cart. Our protocols evaluate haptic feedback latency, collision detection systems, and master console ergonomics during extended procedures. Our facility accommodates full robotic systems including patient carts, vision systems, and surgeon consoles configured to match clinical setups.

column4: Comprehensive combination product testing for drug-coated balloons across coating characterization, drug elution profiling, and vascular tissue uptake validation.
column27: Why Choose Synchrony for Drug-Coated Balloon Testing
column28: Our DCB testing capabilities stem from decades of balloon catheter specialization combined with deep understanding of combination product regulatory requirements.
column31: Two fully-equipped cath labs with high-resolution fluoroscopy, digital subtraction angiography, IVUS integration, and hemodynamic monitoring systems enable parallel testing programs and complex procedural simulations that replicate clinical conditions.
column34: Our team includes interventional specialists who understand deployment mechanics, veterinary pathologists experienced with vascular healing, and regulatory experts who've guided dozens of cardiovascular devices through successful FDA submissions.
column37: Over four decades of exclusive cardiovascular device testing has produced hundreds of successful FDA submissions. Our submission success rate exceeds industry averages through comprehensive preclinical packages that address reviewer expectations.
column40:
Drug-coated balloons need to prove they can maintain coating integrity through tortuous anatomy, transfer therapeutic drug concentrations during brief inflation periods, and achieve sustained tissue uptake that prevents restenosis. We test coating uniformity using micro-CT and scanning electron microscopy, characterize drug elution kinetics under physiological flow conditions, and quantify vascular tissue penetration through advanced histological analysis. Our protocols evaluate coating adhesion during catheter transit, drug release during balloon inflation, and therapeutic agent retention in vessel walls throughout extended follow-up periods.

From paclitaxel-eluting systems for peripheral intervention to novel drug formulations for coronary applications, our testing addresses both device performance and pharmaceutical requirements that define combination product submissions. Our catheterization laboratories feature specialized equipment for real-time coating visualization, drug distribution mapping, and tissue uptake quantification throughout the complete deployment sequence. Whether pursuing 510(k) clearance through predicate comparison or PMA approval for breakthrough formulations, our GLP-compliant protocols generate the comprehensive data packages FDA requires for combination product approval.
